intro: Pogonolepis lanigera, commonly known as the woolly pogonolepis, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. Pogonolepis lanigera is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained environments. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
